result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Craig J Ruhl was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

timeConds.notes: With huber and to commence immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig J Ruhl

records.addlTxt:
8:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Emily Bell.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by DA Christenson, moves to amend count 1 to OWI - 4th offense, a misdemeanor and will dismiss count 2.  Atty Bell concurs.  State files an amended information with the court.  Attorney Bell and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged in the amended information.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Bell.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

12 months county jail, stayed and places the defendanton probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-6 months county jail, with huber and to commence immediately.
-$1200 fine plus court costs
-BDF - $42.50
-D.L. revocation for 30 months
-IID - 30 months
-AODA - Green Lake
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit - if revoked.

Court orders the $250 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 9:01 a.m.
Status hearing at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

9:01 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Emily Bell.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bell - requests one more status hearing.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 23, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:02 a.m.
State's
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits
State's Exhibit #1 & #2
Status hearing at 10-12-2015 09:00 am

8:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Emily Bell.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.

Michael Prachel sworn, direct by DA Christenson is employed as a deputy sheriff and was so employed on the date in question.  Venue Established.  Identified the defendant present in court.  State's Exhibit #1 - Lab Report of Findings.  State offers exhibit #1.  No Objection.  Court receives Exhibit #1 into evidence.

Cross exam by Atty Bell.  State's Exhibit #2.  State offers exhibit #2.  NO objection.  Court receives exhibit #2.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and probable cause that the felony was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Bell and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Bell enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on October 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:52 a.m.
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 08:30 am

10:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Emily Bell.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bell - requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Court will set for preliminary hearing on August 31, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:08 a.m.
to Extend Time to File Pretrial Motions
By Atty Andrew Mishlove
Status hearing at 07-06-2015 10:00 am

ADDRESS INFO for Craig J Ruhl

Prior: 303 N Howard St, Princeton, WI 54968

Notice of Hearing for Status Hearing scheduled on 06/02/2015 at 11:00 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  No Mail Receptacle.  Unable to Forward.  Per Jail - defendant's address is:  W3651 Beyers Cove  Princeton, WI  54968
Status hearing at 06-02-2015 11:00 am

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
w/conditions
Status hearing at 06-02-2015 09:30 am

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2:57 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 2, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:00 p.m.
